biography.bio: Günter Lamprecht was born on January 21, 1930 in Berlin-Wilmersdorf, Germany. He is an actor and writer, known for Das Boot (1981), The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979) and Berlin Alexanderplatz (1980).
biography.name: Günter Lamprecht

biography.bio: Antje Hagen was born on August 10, 1938 in Pethau, Germany. She is known for her work on Le Tourbillon de l'amour (2005), Das Fräulein (1967) and Alle Jahre wieder: Die Familie Semmeling (1976). She was previously married to Günter Jendrich.
biography.name: Antje Hagen

biography.bio: Friedrich W. Bauschulte was born on March 17, 1923 in Münster, Germany as Friedrich Wilhelm Bauschulte. He was an actor and director, known for Der Strick (1966), Petit pierre aux pays des reves (1990) and Wer zu spät kommt - Das Politbüro erlebt die deutsche Revolution (1990). He died on May 28, 2003 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Friedrich W. Bauschulte

biography.bio: Dieter B. Gerlach was born on May 23, 1942 as Dieter Brian Gerlach. He is an actor and writer, known for Rote Rosen (2006), Frontiers of Darkness (1979) and Direktion City (1976).
biography.name: Dieter B. Gerlach

biography.bio: Ulli Kinalzik was born on February 26, 1939 in Grabów nad Prosna, Wielkopolskie, Poland as Hans-Ulrich Kinalzik. He is an actor and writer, known for Direktion City (1976), Verschwörung in Ulm - Der Reichswehrprozeß 1930 (1971) and The Neverending Story III (1994). He has been married to Rita Engelmann since 1970.
biography.name: Ulli Kinalzik

biography.bio: Carlos M. Bravo is an actor, known for Frontiers of Darkness (1979).
biography.name: Carlos M. Bravo

biography.bio: Román A.N. González is an actor, known for Frontiers of Darkness (1979).
biography.name: Román A.N. González

biography.bio: Ayten Erten is an actress, known for Shirins Hochzeit (1976), Goldener Sonntag (1976) and Frontiers of Darkness (1979).
biography.name: Ayten Erten

biography.bio: Started acting 1952 at state theatres in Hamburg. Since early 70ies she has been engaged in German-Polish reconcilation thus she has become a journalist and film critic on Eastern European films. 1979 she started editing her own periodical 'German Film' (together with Ron Holloway).
biography.name: Dorothea Moritz

biography.bio: Andreas Mannkopff was born on May 17, 1939 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Direktion City (1976), Die Wicherts von nebenan (1986) and Otto - Der Film (1985). He died on October 9, 2015 in Berlin.
biography.name: Andreas Mannkopff

biography.bio: Engelbert von Nordhausen was born on January 2, 1948 in Schmölln, Germany. He is an actor, known for Fabian (1980), Résiste - Aufstand der Praktikanten (2009) and Im Fluss des Lebens (2011).
biography.name: Engelbert von Nordhausen

biography.placeOfBirth: Breslau, Silesia, Germany [now Wroclaw, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Jürgen Klauß was born in 1944 in Breslau, Silesia, Germany as Jürgen Karl Klauß. He was a director and actor, known for Ohne Rückfahrkarte (1981), Bread and Films (1980) and Die Entspanner (1984). He died on September 11, 2009 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Jürgen Klauß

biography.bio: Versatile stage and screen actress best known for Werner Herzog films (Best Supporting winner at Cannes for "Woyzeck"). Possibly her most acclaimed starring role is as her mentor 'Rainer Werner Fassbinder' in "A Man Called EVA" (Fassbinder, who treated Eva Mattes kindly, was sometimes referred to by his initials RWF). The daughter of a film composer father and actress mother, Mattes first gained attention in her teens, when she began her acting career: for Fassbinder (Jail Bait, Bitter Tears of Petra von Kant, Effi Briest), as a Vietnamese rape victim (Verhoven's O.K., based on the same tragedy as Casualties of War (1989)), and briefly stumbling into early 70s exploitation fare (Naked Massacre, based on the Richard Speck murders). Mattes moved into leads in prestige and socially conscious films, including Herzog's "Stroszek" (as a German prostitute who flees to the U.S.), Fassbinder's "In A Year of 13 Moons" (as the daughter of a transsexual), Adlon's Céleste (1980) (the title role, as Proust's devoted aide), and Hauff's Mathias Kneissl (1971) (the German Robin Hood). Her recent roles include the mother of the young go-between in Enemy at the Gates, and opposite Isaach De Bankole (the assassin in Casino Royale (2006)) in Otomo. Recently she turned to singing (a CD of English-language standards, 2006) and doing children's films, as well as stage dramas and musicals. As of 2008, she's starring in the world's longest-running detective series, Tatort. In addition to her artist daughter Hanna (with director Werner Herzog), Mattes also has a son Josef, a busy young actor.
biography.name: Eva Mattes

biography.bio: Elisabeth Trissenaar was born on April 13, 1944 in Vienna, Austria. She is an actress and writer, known for The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979), In a Year with 13 Moons (1978) and Angry Harvest (1985). She is married to Hans Neuenfels. They have one child.
biography.name: Elisabeth Trissenaar
